page.title: 14TEMPLE NORMANTON'S OLD FOLK.
page.content: Temple Normanton is a small village with no shops, doctor or church and an infrequent bus service. Despite the lack of amenities most of the elderly residents live contented lives. This is mainly due to the help given by caring families and friends. The accommodation is controlled by a warden who ensures that medical help is promptly given in emergencies. A mobile shop calls weekly but most old people rely on families to shop for them and collect their pensions from nearby Hasland. Organised social activities are restricted to a Senior Citizens' Club offering bingo, snooker and outings. They are also invited to school concerts but many elderly people rely on television and visits from family and friends for entertainment.
